38834262.review:
:: How I come to Hexels ::
I tend to use Photoshop / Illustrator for daily designer-related tasks and GameMaker Image Editor for in-game assets sometimes. But yes, I come to Hexels because they have all-in-one toolset from making grid-based pixel art asset/concept to animating them. Even that I use the cracked version 2.03 quite a long time ago before actually bought Hexels 3 on Steam (since trial time wasn't enough when I forgot to use it) just to make sure  it's getting better right now ( and indeed, it's ).

:: Rating ::
My experience with Hexels 3 was quite good, although I haven't used much. 

:: Pros ::
+ The toolset was very simple and easy to use.
+ Kinda light-weight  and light-performance  on usage.

+ Animation was pretty comfortable to use.

+ GLOW : 
special feature to glow your pixel art like HDR.

+ Flexible Brush setting and sizing the same to Photoshop.

+ Selection / Scaling / Photoshop basic tool-like... are all included !

+ Good Layer functionality : 
alike to photoshop, including blending mode.

+ Many Grid Modes : 
Square / Hex / Trixel .... this actually what made Hexel unique.

:: Cons ::

- BUG: 
I still see crashing on first saving ( if I move or change the UI )

- COLOR PICKER :
For now, only 2 modes are included, which I don't like much.
I expect a more useful color picker, like Photoshop's CMYK or a Hexagram of dimming color.

- Not yet Flexible UI : 
as you can't really "Dock" Color panel to the left ( I'm left hander ! ) 
and main toolset UI bar is fixed to the left.

-  A bit expensive at some regions : 
50$ ? are you kidding me ? 
Also I bought during sale :)

- STEAM ONLY : stick to Steam license and you can't link to use standalone.

:: Verdict ::
I recommend this great tool to any indie artists, 
who is struggling with Photoshop complicated Timeline 
or just want a compact too specially made for pixel art !

* P/S to developers : 
I really hope you guys improve features and stable performance in the future release :)

38785439.review:
Pretty fun program to use. Have only tried out one way of using it but it has several different templates to choose from, depending on what you want to make: 
[olist]
 [*]Trixels - A triangular grid and vector art canvas for drawing crist, isometric shapes at any resolution
 [*]Pixel Trixels 1080p (A large triangular grid for drawing all sorts of pointy and isometric shapes. Perfectly pixelated for a 1080p export)
 [*]Pixel Trixels 256p (A small triangular grid for drawing all sorts of pointy and isometric shapes. Perfectly pixelated for tiny sprites and pixel art)
 [*]Exels (A trixel grid set up for drawing square "exels", rectangles sliced twice diagonally into 4 triangles)
 [*]Hexels Classic (Tried and trie Hexagonal Grid)
 [*]Voronoi (A randomly generated, cellular grid that also tiles at the borders)
 [*]Squares (Square pixels, the kind grandma used to school you with in Pong)
 [*]Houndstooth (Fashion is danger! A custom shape mode straight from Savile Row.)
 [*]Halftone Squares (Squares with size based on color opacity (Halftone mode).)
 [*]Halftone Circles (Overlapping circles with size based on color opacity (Halftone mode).)
 [*]Groovy Voronoi (Textured Voronoi tiles make a groovy pattern!)

A very handy tool if you want to look into making stylized or pixel art which is how a lot of indie games have been going the past few years. It gives a very crisp look to your work. Has a lot of nice effects too and it seems pretty straight forward to use. Managed to whip up a nice cityscape in no time using this with no prior knowledge.

Worth grabbing in the sale, definetly.

37558576.review:
Выйти из приложения можно только с ошибкой. Нету импорта пикселя нормального, только кривой и/или замыленый. Для меня до сих пор загадка как делать пиксельный слой без блура, нажимая антиаласинг, отключения свечения блока-слоя-документа, я уже не знаю что и где нажимать (как оказалось это из за импорта гифа на пиксельный слой, если создать пустой пиксельный слой и слить его с рабочим на котором импорт, то алилуя, мыло исчезает). Неудобная трансформация слоя. Не запоминает папку для сохранения/открытия. Если папки недайбох на русском вы её просто не найдете, найдете не откроет файл (файл на английском). При трансформации слоев с сеткой, пиксельный может вести себя как хочет. Крашнулась при удалении большого куска через выделение.

А это я только пару часов в проге, еще анимацию не пробовала! Как-то спс, я пока с изометрией побалуюсь. Она действительно "вкусная" – не поспоришь.
Хороша для создания бесшовных фонов рисованных "ручками" (не текстур, она не подгоняет края, только рисует один большой повторяющийся фон)
(дополнено) С импортом анимации (маленькой гифки 64х64) все плохо. Там просто хлеб для тестера начинается.

Сказать что мне нравится? Мне все нравится на самом деле. Мне нравятся еще более криповые штуки с интерфейсом "вытекли глазки" и "гдеж это найтито?". Но все остальные это не Я.

Дополню переводом англоязычного пользователя. Потому что не хотелось придираться, но просто человек читает мои мысли.
(итак, вольный перевод)
Нету инструмента свободного преобразования. Инструмента изменения перспектив(и "скоса").
Нету выбора "лассо" и полилинии.
Нету векторных инструментов. Есть выбор сетки, переключатель "вектор" а инструментов нет.
Нет инструментов "shape"
(конец вольного перевода)

Надеюсь сие чудо допилят, у неё большой "потанцевал". Но это пока. Пока смотрите 128 тем на форуме в разделе багов/репортов.
(отзыв дополняется по мере выявленных багов и ништяков)

35485055.review:
So now that I have put enough time into Hexel 2.5, or should I say Hexel 3 now, I think I can finally put in a honest review on how I feel about this program.

For someone like myself who started to work into pixel art I can very easily say that Hexel 3 is a fantastic program. It's easy to learn, it opens up options for what you can do and it's just down right fun to try out some of the stuff you can test out in the program. 

If there is one thing I have to say bad about the program is that it doesn't have a mirror effect while your drawling, but even that is such a minor problem that I myself kind of forgot about until now writing this review.

Overall, it's a fantastic program and I can't wait to see what else they do with it down the road.

35351521.review: Solid interface, easy to use, beginner friendly. Animation and effects/shaders are where Hexels shine. You can use effects to fake real life actions. For the price, i really recommend Hexels. At discount seasons, it is a must-buy for pixelart lover indie developers.

35347461.review:
Marmoset Hexels is great. I got it in a Humble Bundle a while ago, and while I don't use it that much (normally when I do anything regarding images it's just messing around in photoshop to make some memes for my friends, and I'm not that great at actually creating new works of art or anything) but if you're like me and you find isometric and pixel art interesting, and you actually want to create art or animations using those styles or similar ones (Hexels isn't just limited to those kinds of things, they have other interesting modes as well, and I'm pretty sure you can combine multiple types in one piece), then I'd highly recommend this. Once you learn the keyboard shortcuts and how to manage some of the settings, it's relatively easy to use, while still having enough options to allow for a high degree of customization.

31975355.review:
Merece mucho la pena. Si has trabajado con píxeles en el pasado, seguro que te suena el utilizar Illustrator para crear imágenes vectoriales e importarlas en Photoshop para texturizar, renderizar y añadir glow. Y sí, puedes configurar Photoshop para trabajar con píxeles y realizar animaciones sencillas frame-by-frame, pero su cuadrícula es muy limitada y encima poco precisa tanto para dibujar con el ratón como desde tableta. Al final es más cómodo trabajar con Illustrator creando figuras geométricamente compatibles con pixel-art, y luego darle ese estilo pixelado manualmente. Por último, búscate una buena suite para animar en 2D, lo suficientemente potente como para poder trabajar con escenas amplias, pero con una curva de aprendizaje óptima y un precio medianamente decente...

Claro que existen soluciones completas en el mercado, aunque las mejores están orientadas bien a animación 2D tipo cartoon que tienes que adaptar a tu trabajo con píxeles, o si no a la creación de sprites y animaciones para videojuegos limitando el tamaño de las escenas y en muchos casos las opciones de exportación. Además, vete sumando el precio de cada herramienta de software adicional que debes adquirir con su correspondiente tiempo de aprendizaje para conseguir manejarla con cierta solvencia. 

Con Marmoset Hexels llevo trabajando poco, pero no quería pasar la oportunidad de recomendarla ampliamente viendo que es escasamente popular. Es extremadamente versátil a la hora de trabajar con patrones preestablecidos e incluso creando los tuyos propios, tiene un sistema de animación frame-by-frame bastante más potente que el de Photoshop, con algunas opciones avanzadas de renderizado, texturizado y glow. Interfaz no destructiva y un sistema de trabajo por capas y multiframe que resultará muy cómodo a quien venga de trabajar con software de Adobe.

En definitiva, es una EXTRAORDINARIA aunque muy específica herramienta. Es todo lo que necesitas para diseñar y animar pixel-arts a un nivel casi profesional (solo echo de menos algunas opciones más avanzadas de texturizado y renderizado, aún así se puede exportar a .psd y solucionarlo en Photoshop) agrupando una docena de excelentes ideas que antes teníamos que ir parcheando saltando de un programa a otro o haciéndolo manualmente.

Solo decir que da gusto trabajar con herramientas creadas por y para gente que se va a dedicar a utilizarlas. Se nota el mimo por el detalle en muchas de sus funciones, a destacar por ejemplo la enorme flexibilidad del sistema de cuadrícula y supercuadrícula que tiene, con varias funciones avanzadas que dejan en evidencia programas con presupuestos multimillonarios como PS.

31549311.review:
This is a great software! If you enjoy making pixel or voxel art, this is right up your alley.
There are just a few things i'm missing however, or at least not able to find.
1. Being able select all layers at once and moving everything selected on the screen.
2. Mirroring a selection (not just inverting it or flipping it).
3. Editing the glow of every layer individually instead of globally. (I know there's a glow option on the layers, but it's maxed out already.)
4. I also had problems with the animator, i cannot seem to get the opacity working, it's stuck globally so every frame has the same opacity, which is troublesome if you want to make something utilizing the opacity options.
Then there are many other minor tweaks but that's just going into detail and nothing to add into a review, it's long enough as it is already.

31517530.review:
В игростроении одной из основных проблем - контент.
[b]Marmoset Hexels 2[/b]  решает вопрос создания спрайтов для [b]2D игр[/b] и последующего их анимирования, фонов и подобного арта, круг применения достаточно широкий.
Само рисование происходит в одной из предложенных [b]сеток[/b] (или же настроенных), которые можно менять во время работы.
Опционально настраивается освещение, возможны манипуляции со слоями (это также сильно поможет при анимировании).
Да, для работы с программой придется освоить интерфейс и доступные инструменты, но для этого достаточно знаний английского и доступных туториалов от разработчиков (впрочем, опять же найти видеоуроки в русском в интернете не должно составить проблем или просто примеров работ в ней, можно найти чему научиться).
Для работы инди-разработчиков с 2D контентом просто незаменима.

31506513.review:

Пробовала рисовать в пробной версии, понравилось, поэтому давно ждала скидку на этот софт.
Минусы: Нет русского языка
Для меня сложновато как для новичка пиксель артов.

31503016.review:
Отличная программа для рисования если не умеешь рисовать от слова "Вообще-Совсем". (Шутка с долей шутки)
Вообще обзор стоит начать с того, что если не нужна изометрия или какие то фокусы с привязкой к настраиваемой сетке, то практически все тоже самое можно найти в других программах в том числе и бесплатных. 
=====================
Программа стоит того что бы вы обратили на нее внимание, в том случае если вы НЕ хотите рисовать какие то детальные рисунки, если вы рисуете плохо но вам нужно рисовать в чем то, если вы не умеете рисовать а вам нужны спрайты в стиле пиксельарта или чего то в похожем стиле, если вам нужна анимация спрайтов. 
Неоспоримый плюс программы - низкий, очень низкий порог вхождения, все очень просто настраивается, и интуитивно разобраться очень очень просто.

p.s. рисовать не умею.
p.p.s. вообще ни разу не художник (хотя нет обманываю, художник от слова ХУДО).
p.p.p.s. не умею писать обзоры. (читать перед прочтением обзора)

30660739.review: Pretty cool, but get it on sale or in a bundle. Really specialized piece of software. Nothing quite like it!

30201865.review:
[h1] Hexels 2 a must for indie game devs[/h1]
Hexels 2 is amazing, it is very easy to learn and one of the pros for game devs is that you can quickly prototype some art for your game. The grid can be seen as a limitation or a con of this software, but in my opinion it helps you create art faster and make it look nicer. The last part is mostly for people that have struggles with traditional art tools. If you can get this software for a good price I would definitely try it.

30177054.review:
Awesome little art program. Thumbs up, even at it's full price. It's arguably more fun than Black Ink which I like (don't fully understand it, but I'm trying :P) and certainly more usable for certain styles, and for a lower price.

I got it as part of a humble bundle (which I mainly bought for Spriter Pro, this was an added bonus), so I don't know if I'd have made the purchase at full price first off, but after having used it for a couple of hours (which you can do as part of their trial version) I already know I'll get loads of fun out of this program, and so if I'd gone the trial route I'd probably have bought it soon after anyway.

All I've done so far is made a couple of quick animated GIFs with the software, and I can see that it's really suited to that, as well as still pieces. Though I'm having loads of fun with the animation as it's the first ever art software I enjoy animating within. I'll get back to doing still pieces with it in the future and maybe re-review it then.

I could see someone who spent long hours working with this be able to create insanely intricate scenes and animations. And there's no real learning curve for a beginner, even if I do come from a digital art background (I mainly use Krita and Black Ink), I could see it being a fun program for a non traditional artist to excell in (though I'd be interested to see what the traditional artist could make with it.)

For those of you who think it doesn't look versatile, it can do a lot more than you might think at first glance. In fact you can make pieces so smooth they don't look like they were even painted with hexels or trixels (the main painting mode). It also has a well developed pixel art mode. It also has a user customisable shape mode where you can make the most insane looking paintings known to mankind.

Animation is super easy. Compared to many tools with animation options (such as krita 3 which I love for still art but abhor for animation) the process of learning how to make somewhat decent animations is very fast. My first piece was a minecraft/fez style isometric block world with a working day night cycle, my second, a dragon breathing fire down onto a warrior, who backs up and raises their shield. Other than watching a couple of artists videos for inspiration the night before, I worked through zero tutorials.

I use a pen monitor (Ugee 1910b) with it, though many awesome artists (including Mark Knight who I mention later) use just a mouse to draw their creations, which makes this program especially suited to a beginner digital artist who may not own or want to buy even a cheap drawing tablet.

If you want to see some awesome artworks made entirely in this software I reccomend you check out Mark Knight's Hexels youtube channel (https://www.youtube.com/user/redcastle60187) and Tumblr page. He's the reason I decided to give it a go. He makes amazing art based on film and video game scenes, objects and characters.

Hope my review was somewhat helpful, and if you buy Hexels that you get as much enjoyment out of it the first few hours as I have :D

29555122.review: After using this to create some awesome scenery for some time now, I can definitely say this is some powerful software.  To start, the UI is pretty simple, and packs a lot.  In the palette, you can mix colors and blend others, to help with shading.  You can add and remove frames, to make editing easier, and in some cases, faster.  Having multiple grids (and custom grids) helps to add detail, or maybe a different perspective, and you can change the grid anytime, on any layer.  Whenever you export your image, you can change the scale of the image, to make it bigger (more hd) or smaller (less hd).  This software is very fine, and I would recommend this to anyone.

And you can animate your images real easy, I really can't give this program enough credit.
It's... so... good....

29090533.review:
Note: I am using the program offiline while travelling, therefore only few minutes on Steam record. I did use it for several hours already.

I bought this as part of the Humble Bundle. For my game graphics I do mainly use Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Blender, ArtRage, Artmatic. I had very litte expectations of Hexels in respect to usability, results, productivity etc. And I am not a big fan of pixel arts for my games.

But I was very positively surprised. Hexels is a powerful tool, easy and intuitively to use. It is really fun to create graphics "consciously" but as well in a more random, experimental, lets-see way. The results are great. I would pay the full price.

I am so convinced, that I am now using it for the player-sprites of my latest game. I create different layers in Hexels, create vector-graphics (SVG) in Illustrator, and Extrude it in Blender. The actual cration in Hexels is a real creative process and not hindered at all by the interfaces/ unnecessary complexity.

The only thing I am missing is the possibility to experot an SVG (vector) file.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDABLE.

29079736.review:
Что можно сказать о данной программе? Это прикольная рисовалка на пятнадцать минут или для узконаправленного рисования чего бы там не было в стиле пиксель Арт. Цена такому продукту отнюдь не те деньги которые она стоит сейчас, тем не менее мне повезло купить ее со скидкой. 
 И так в чем же суть и инструментарий данной программы? Вот есть у тебя сеточка, красивая сеточка такая ровненькая равномерная. И есть у тебя интерфейс копирующий фотошоп. Ты, с полными радости глазами после покупки сие продукта думаешь, вот сейчас начнется творчество... нет ТВОРЧЕСТВО с большой буквы. Но нет. Случается вождение по сетке кисточкой или линейкой и буквально не рисование а "собирание" изображения из квадратиков и прочего. Программа затянула да, но на первые пятнадцать минут. 
 Да она выглядит стильно, выглядит приятно и темные интерфейсы это вообще мое любимое, но не одним же интерфейсом едины. Я не жалуюсь на функционал, не оцениваю программу по тому, что она создана компанией Мармосет. Я просто думаю, стоит ли эта программа тех денег за которые они готовы вам ее отдать? И все же думаю что нет. 
 Я не рекомендую покупать данный продукт, при условии что вы не занимаетесь пиксель артом и у вас нет постоянных заказов в этой сфере.

28779952.review:
This Software is a gem!

Im more of an traditional artsy guy, but this is one of the few digital drawing programs I use.
It is very fun to use and kept simple, but offers a lot of ways to experiment and vent your artistic urges.
I really enjoy the smooth color palette and the little features for color shades. Very intuitive.

Sure, there are a couple of small things that need improvement and here and there is the occassional bug,
but it is still a unique art program and I love it.

It just needs more Hotkeys and a list for them.

---

One problem I have right now is the Frame Tool, which is kind of weird, even though I do apreciate its existence.
If you try to make an 300ppi A6 size frame (1240 x 1748px) for cropping and then A4 frame  (2480 x 3508px), the frame doesnt get bigger, which is really upsetting when you try to make bigger or higher resolution images or even just try to fit everything into the frame, which just does not work.

28779948.review: I bought this on a whim and Im glad I did. It's really fun to play around in but also quite powerful. The animation is really nice and streamlined. The pixel painting is very versatile and pretty intuative. I do wish there was better tutorials. The Marmoset website has some tutorials but I feel like this program has so much more depth, and I wish I knew how to unlock  it. Still awesome though.

28743500.review:
10/10 Easy to use, great results.

Hexels is an amazing software, I started off by creating some pixel art using Piskel, it was good but pretty basic, I then found and bought Hexels, just to test it out I randomly started drawing without any real goal, I noticed right away that the lighting system added so much to the drawing, in a second flat I learned everything I needed to know and got better results while using this software, I was already really happy with this so I started checking out the rest of the different styles you can use, I found out that those were even better, this software is amazing for pixel art but even better for everything else, I highly recommend this software, even if you have no idea what you're doing.

Overall, if you like doing isometric or pixel-style art, I highly recommend this program as a versatile tool to your artistic arsenal.

26668389.review:
Hexels 2 is good. It's good for what it does and its unique grid based painting has some interesting possibilities compred to the other pixel art tools out there. However, I think it still has some more rooms for a improvement because the base technology sounds great but it feels a bit under utilized.

For example, it could be a really great tool for creating not just a piece of art but in-game ready isometric art assets, but it isn't that straight forward yet. Adding some constraint drawing mode can help a lot with this tool. Hexels looks like it can create awesome angled, isometric pixel art and it dose, but it just need that extra drawing tools / modifiers to help itself.

Having said all that, I am eager and hopeful for the future development of this tool and it just may be the Maya of 2D pixel art. It just need that 10% f extra "ohh, cool" factor when you actually use the tool. Hexels can already do a lot, but it can do a lot better.

25874336.review: Well worth the money, Super easy to use and the output is great. Would recommend to anyone.

25586455.review:
Пожалуй самый удобный инструмент для пиксельарта и его анимации в природе. 

+ Огромный ПОТЕНЦИА́Л, после 20 часов юзал только стандартные пиксели, хексели, и анимацию, в программе еще просто море других возможных вариантов и их комиляции. 
+ Легко освоить, знать английский интерфейс, итак крайне простой в принципе не обьязательно, все сделано интуитивно. 
+ Обучающее видео в описании игры, никаких гайдов не потребуеться. 
+ Постоянные апдейды, разработчики следят и все время что-то корректируют в нужную сторону.
+ Можно с планшетом.(vacoom intuos например)
+ Цена хоть и кусаеться, но для такого продуката не заоблачная, оправдывает своё.
+ Прстейший импорт в png/gif и другие форматы, для игроделов вообще в самый раз.



Из минусов
- Сьедает все ваше свободное время. (О а надо бы еще и сюда что-то прикрутить и это тоже анимумирую, и вот это...)
- Требоватален. Нужен нормальный компьютер, на Core i5 и средней видеокарте в 256 Х 256 анимация будет сильно лагать. 
- Разве что вылетел пару раз, но при это все сохранил, так что скорее вина видеокарты.

23609710.review:
> Not masked behind a paywall
> No extremely high-priced DLC
> Only need a mouse to make works of art
> Just a genuine, art-making program

Hexels 2 brings in a well-optimised and extremely customisable pixel / isometric / hexel / trixel / grid-art program. This program is wonderful to use if you enjoy making art but don't have the art skills that is mostly required with pen and paper / drawing pads.

> The program itself is well optimised and gives you a good range of options
> Wonderful colour pallete, allowing you to find the perfect shade between two colours
> Extremely high resolution output
> Glow feature to give your art a bit more texture
> Seriously, get it

As a person who doesn't do well with drawing, this program lets me bring out my creations with just my mouse, and that alone is a dealbreaker for me.

23498797.review:
몇가지 패치를 해주세요. 


1. 애니메이션 할 때 그림을 자유롭게 자르고 회전, 이동, 비틀기 등, 에디터 가능하게 해주세요
2. 휴세츄레이션(색상보정) 기능 꼭 널어주세요. 색상을 바꾸기 너무 힘듭니다. 그림을 그리는 기본 기능입니다
3. 다각형 (세노, 네모,동그라미 등등 ) 기능을 넣어 주세요. 
4. shape? 이 기능을 레이어 마다 다르게 줄 수 있게 해주세요. 
5. 레이어에 그린 그림을 이동하는 이동 툴이 없습니다.  만들어주세요(레이어 층간 이동이 아니라 그림이동입니다)

이렇게 5가지만 우선 패치해 주신다면 다른 어떤 프로그램 보다 우수한 프로그램이 될 것 같습니다. 
지금 많이 답답합니다. 애니메이션 할 때 전부 다시 그리고 다시 그리고..... 휴

23240963.review:
Marmoset Hexels 2,

At first I was a bit, let's say, skeptical. Another piece of software that says it does something others don't or can't do as easy.

As a hobby, wannabee game developer I'm often in need of fast and easy ways to create certain types of graphics. Hex grids, tiled backgrounds, that kind of stuff.

With this software I'm just able to do that. Create a tiled map and texture every single section anyway I see fit.
Export the thing as a png, maybe do some post work on it and I'm set to use it in my favorite game developing  application.

Just for that, for the ease of use, I give Marmoset Hexels 2 a big thumbs up.

21542298.review:
这是一种能够自我编辑图元，并且利用图元为基本单位进行绘图的软件。用了几天，不是很顺手，毕竟开发人员的思维比较超前，与传统的绘图软件相比有些本质差别，不过在绘制一些特殊的地图和人物时会显得比较方便。
         喜欢做游戏的小伙伴可以考虑入手，不过现阶段比较贵，可以先观望，等打折了再买，全价买还是有些贵。

21522766.review:
Hexels 2 is just brilliant, learned all the things within an hour and made up another version of the room samples, but this time in my way. It's just amazing. you can create your own shorts and GIFs and probably make your own miniseries with this. The UI is just plain awesome, I had no issues at all. You new content creators don't even need tutorials, it's very easy to learn and can unlock your mind to PC Graphics at the entry level. This software is just bomb. Definately reccommend this to any of you graphic designers and people who want to have fun making some art.

10/10, No reason to suspect otherwise.

21273369.review:
Hexels belongs to this growing family of small indie tools that allows you to do great things. I've followed its development since a while, and have been involved in several beta testing phases. It's a joy to see this software evolve and finally make it to Steam. It's among the rare tools I keep coming back to.

As a game designer with an artistic background but an increasing interest in programming, I had given up on drawing years ago, but Hexels kind of motivated me to do art again. It's fun to use, and it stands in a domain of its own, part pixel art, part, well, something else. While the core concept is dead simple, it's very versatile, and with a few tweaks you can create amazing stuff. It's not only about filling a grid: there's also outlines, textures, layers, animations... and the glow. Oh man, the glow!

I should also mention the main dev is a really nice and helpful guy, and the support team at Marmoset is very reactive.

So in case you're still wondering, yes, Hexels 2 is definitely worth it price!

21264345.review: very fun. would love some more tutorials. i am a n00b.

21257774.review:
Hexels 1 was not that good really, but hexels 2 really killed it. I must say really impressed how they changed everything to something really amazing, with all this different tools. 

If still are an Hexels 1 User and still have your doubts. Trust me! You want Hexels 2.
